output.conclusion: This course provided a foundational understanding of structural analysis principles. Further study and practical application are essential for mastery.
output.introduction: Welcome to Structural Analysis! This course introduces fundamental concepts for analyzing structures under various loads.

chapters.description: Overview of structural elements (beams, columns, trusses) and their functions.
Explanation of different load types (dead, live, wind, seismic) and their characteristics.
Discussion on different support types (hinged, roller, fixed) and their reactions.
Understanding and applying the equations of static equilibrium (sum of forces and moments).
Creating free body diagrams to represent structures and their loads.
Calculating support reactions using equilibrium equations.
Introduction to axial forces in structural members.
Introduction to shear forces in structural members.
Introduction to bending moments in structural members.
Constructing shear and moment diagrams for simple beams.

chapters.chapterTitle: Relationship Between Load, Shear, and Moment
chapters.description: Understanding the relationships between load, shear force, and bending moment.
Understanding the sign conventions used in drawing shear and moment diagrams
Basic concepts of stress (normal and shear).
Basic concepts of strain (normal and shear).
Understanding the relationship between stress and strain (Hooke's Law).
Understanding the concept of deflection in beams.
Discussion on factors influencing beam deflection (load, material, geometry).
